bug.author: 14sudharsan
bug.summary: Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress
bug.description:
when i tried to install kubeflow v0.6 in EKS cluster with help of this link <denchmark-link:https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow>https://master.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow</denchmark-link>
root@ip-172-31-31-235:~/hcl-cluster-kf# kubectl version Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.10-eks-f12431", GitCommit:"f12431e9d92fa990fbbc2b52006351d381bd4bed", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-01T23:43:58Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13+", GitVersion:"v1.13.10-eks-5ac0f1", GitCommit:"5ac0f1d9ab2c254ea2b0ce3534fd72932094c6e1", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-20T22:39:46Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.13", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} root@ip-172-31-31-235:~/hcl-cluster-kf# eksctl version [‚Ñπ] version.Info{BuiltAt:"", GitCommit:"", GitTag:"0.5.3"} Getting below Error root@ip-172-xx-xx-xxx:~/testing-cluster-kf# kfctl generate all -V INFO[0000] Downloading /root/testing-cluster-kf/app.yaml to /tmp/790876065/app.yaml filename="v1alpha1/application_types.go:334" INFO[0000] Writing stripped KfDef to /root/testing-cluster-kf/app.yaml filename="v1alpha1/application_types.go:626" INFO[0000] Downloading /root/testing-cluster-kf/app.yaml to /tmp/584471180/app.yaml filename="v1alpha1/application_types.go:334" INFO[0000] Caller ARN Info: { Account: "245980173641", Arn: "arn:aws:iam::245980173641:user/rapydipa", UserId: "AIDATSRMPSVEVZLSCJBC6" } filename="utils/awsutil.go:38" INFO[0000] AWS infrastructure configs already exist in directory /root/testing-cluster-kf/aws_config filename="aws/aws.go:323" INFO[0000] Reading config file: /root/testing-cluster-kf/aws_config/cluster_features.yaml filename="aws/aws.go:768" INFO[0000] Reading config file: /root/testing-cluster-kf/aws_config/cluster_features.yaml filename="aws/aws.go:768" INFO[0000] Writing stripped KfDef to /root/testing-cluster-kf/app.yaml filename="v1alpha1/application_types.go:626" INFO[0000] Initializing kustomize package map filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:150" message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.64. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I have a similar issue `Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1"`

I believe this is the same as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4057>#4057</denchmark-link> . Looks like it's in pr here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/360>kubeflow/manifests#360</denchmark-link> but has yet to be merged.

A quick workaround if you are using <denchmark-link:http://multipass.run/>multipass</denchmark-link> with <denchmark-link:http://microk8s.io/>microk8s</denchmark-link> is to install v1.14. I just tried it and it worked fine. Follow the steps in <denchmark-link:https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow>https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow</denchmark-link> but install microk8s via instead.
Thanks for the suggestion but no luck same error.
Sorry guys I will try to resolve this issue and make aws components merge into v0.6-branch
/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link>

I believe this is the same as #4057. Looks like it's in pr here kubeflow/manifests#360 but has yet to be merged.
Yeah, i tried to use the work around by using master as the branch for the manifest. But the work around no longer fix the issue.
I used the workaround with tag v0.6.2

Similar issue here. Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress Usage: kfctl generate [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: --email string email if '--platform gcp' -h, --help help for generate --hostname string hostname if '--platform gcp' --ipName string ipName if '--platform gcp' --mount-local mount-local if '--platform minikube' -V, --verbose verbose output default is false --zone string zone if '--platform gcp'

Hi guys, we are encountering this issue too (using v0.6.2 kfctl_aws.yaml as it points to v0.6-branch repo for kubeflow/kubeflow and kubeflow/manisfests) So we have been experimenting with the commits (for days) and we use these: with CONFIG set to the path of kfctl_aws.yaml (Ex: export CONFIG=~/kfctl_aws.yaml) For kubeflow/kubeflow: <denchmark-code>sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6-branch.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/9804feb9fc23fc30075632a857087f4b529294e2.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG} </denchmark-code>
For kubeflow/manifests: <denchmark-code>sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6-branch.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/7a373809a663ded140f9b70a3e879a39f6e88479.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG} </denchmark-code>
I hope this helps.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zmdelima>@zmdelima</denchmark-link> This didn't solve the problem for me. When initializing with I could see it fetched the right version, according to the commit you pointed to, but running still returned the same error.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/plaffitte>@plaffitte</denchmark-link> I am currently using v0.6.1/bootstrap (as this works for me) instead of v0.6.2/bootstrap source. The major difference from them besides the repository targets is having an for the kustomize of . These are my step by step cli commands: <denchmark-code>export CONFIG=~/kfctl_aws.yaml
curl -Lo ${CONFIG} https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.1/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml
# We create an anonymous kubeflow namespace kubectl create namespace kubeflow-anonymous
# Replace lines for the InstanceRole name and AWS Region sed -i "s@eksctl-kubeflow-aws-nodegroup-ng-a2-NodeInstanceRole-xxxxxxx@$ROLE_NAME@" ${CONFIG} sed -i "s@us-west-2@$AWS_REGION@" ${CONFIG}
# Replace repository targets sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/master.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/9804feb9fc23fc30075632a857087f4b529294e2.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG}
sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/7a373809a663ded140f9b70a3e879a39f6e88479.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG} </denchmark-code>
Reference to changes on v0.6 kfctl_aws.yaml file: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commits/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commits/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml</denchmark-link>
Note: If there are repercussions on the missing application overlay to tf-training please inform, thank you.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zmdelima>@zmdelima</denchmark-link> not sure if it is related, but if I do this katib-manager gets stuck in a crash/restart loop Also, I am not able to select namespaces in the UI. centraldashboard generates the following logs: <denchmark-code>Initializing Kubernetes configuration "aws" is not a supported platform for Metrics Using Profiles service at http://profiles-kfam.kubeflow:8081/kfam Server listening on port http://localhost:8082 (in production mode) Unable to get environment info: Unexpected error getting environment info Error: getaddrinfo EAI_AGAIN profiles-kfam.kubeflow profiles-kfam.kubeflow:8081 at GetAddrInfoReqWrap.onlookup [as oncomplete] (dns.js:56:26)
</denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karlschriek>@karlschriek</denchmark-link> I think your error is not related on the deployment of the kubeflow in the EKS Cluster but more on the resolution of your pods.
Please check all your pods via kubectl get pods --all-namespaces kubectl delete pod/<pod-name> -n <pod's namespace> for every crashing pod
if returns please check your EKS VPC <denchmark-link:https://eksctl.io/usage/vpc-networking/>eksctl VPC docs here</denchmark-link> . Good luck.

INFO[0000] Creating AWS infrastructure configs in directory /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/aws_config filename="aws/aws.go:314" Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Generate failed for aws: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: Could not generate cluster configs under aws_config Error: Could not copy /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/.cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-master/deployment/aws/infra_configs/cluster_config.yaml to /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/aws_config/cluster_config.yaml Error cannot create directory: open /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/.cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-master/deployment/aws/infra_configs/cluster_config.yaml: no such file or directory Usage: kfctl generate [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: --email string email if '--platform gcp' -h, --help help for generate --hostname string hostname if '--platform gcp' --ipName string ipName if '--platform gcp' --mount-local mount-local if '--platform minikube' -V, --verbose verbose output default is false --zone string zone if '--platform gcp' couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Generate failed for aws: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: Could not generate cluster configs under aws_config Error: Could not copy /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/.cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-master/deployment/aws/infra_configs/cluster_config.yaml to /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/aws_config/cluster_config.yaml Error cannot create directory: open /home/ec2-user/environment/eksworkshop-eksctl/.cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-master/deployment/aws/infra_configs/cluster_config.yaml: no such file or directory

$ kfctl version kfctl v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6
let me know, if there is any other information you need?

$ kfctl version kfctl v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7 INFO[0000] Processing application: istio-ingress filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:606" Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress Usage: kfctl generate [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: --email string email if '--platform gcp' -h, --help help for generate --hostname string hostname if '--platform gcp' --ipName string ipName if '--platform gcp' --mount-local mount-local if '--platform minikube' -V, --verbose verbose output default is false --zone string zone if '--platform gcp' couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ardeshir>@ardeshir</denchmark-link> I suggest you read my quoted comment below to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/plaffitte>@plaffitte</denchmark-link> 's case. As we are waiting for the resolution of the aws dependencies since the changes in the configuration directories for kfctl_aws.yaml
@plaffitte I am currently using v0.6.1/bootstrap (as this works for me) instead of v0.6.2/bootstrap kfctl_aws.yaml source. The major difference from them besides the repository targets is having an - application for the kustomize of path: tf-training/tf-job-operator. These are my step by step cli commands: export CONFIG=~/kfctl_aws.yaml
curl -Lo ${CONFIG} https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.1/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml
# We create an anonymous kubeflow namespace kubectl create namespace kubeflow-anonymous
# Replace lines for the InstanceRole name and AWS Region sed -i "s@eksctl-kubeflow-aws-nodegroup-ng-a2-NodeInstanceRole-xxxxxxx@$ROLE_NAME@" ${CONFIG} sed -i "s@us-west-2@$AWS_REGION@" ${CONFIG}
# Replace repository targets sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/master.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/9804feb9fc23fc30075632a857087f4b529294e2.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG}
sed -i "s@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz@https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/7a373809a663ded140f9b70a3e879a39f6e88479.tar.gz@" ${CONFIG}
Reference to changes on v0.6 kfctl_aws.yaml file: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commits/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml Note: If there are repercussions on the missing application overlay to tf-training please inform, thank you.

Thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zmdelima>@zmdelima</denchmark-link> , using v0.6.2 and updated the targets as mentioned above got me past
$ kfctl generate all -V But kfctl apply all -V fails
INFO[0002] creating Service/istio-ingressgateway filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:447" Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: Service "istio-ingressgateway" is invalid: spec.ports[1].nodePort: Invalid value: 31380: provided port is already allocated Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: Service "istio-ingressgateway" is invalid: spec.ports[1].nodePort: Invalid value: 31380: provided port is already allocated

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ardeshir>@ardeshir</denchmark-link> that error means your istio-ingress pods are occupying the 31380 port, what I usually do is: <denchmark-code># go to your kubeflow app directory cd ${KFAPP} # delete istio-system namespace kubectl delete namespace istio-system # Generate the configurations again for istio-system kfctl generate all -V # Apply configurations once more kfctl apply all -V </denchmark-code>

Thanks! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zmdelima>@zmdelima</denchmark-link> cleared istio-system and applied once more, and all the pods are running now. $ kubectl get pods -n kubeflow shows them all running!

I was able to follow the workaround to install Kubeflow on EKS 1.14. But the notebook-controller-deployment kep on crashing. The log had the following error message in it 2019-10-13T22:20:03.059Z INFO controller-runtime.metrics metrics server is starting to listen {"addr": ":8080"} 2019-10-13T22:20:03.060Z INFO controller-runtime.controller Starting EventSource {"controller": "notebook", "source": "kind source: /, Kind="} 2019-10-13T22:20:03.060Z ERROR controller-runtime.source if kind is a CRD, it should be installed before calling Start {"kind": "Notebook.kubeflow.org", "error": "no matches for kind "Notebook" in version "kubeflow.org/v1beta1""} github.com/go-logr/zapr.(*zapLogger).Error /go/pkg/mod/github.com/go-logr/zapr@v0.1.0/zapr.go:128 sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/source.(*Kind).Start /go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.2.0/pkg/source/source.go:88 sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/internal/controller.(*Controller).Watch /go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.2.0/pkg/internal/controller/controller.go:122 sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/builder.(*Builder).doWatch /go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.2.0/pkg/builder/controller.go:162 sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime/pkg/builder.(*Builder).Build /go/pkg/mod/sigs.k8s.io/controller-runtime@v0.2.0/pkg/builder/controller.go:151 github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/components/notebook-controller/controllers.(*NotebookReconciler).SetupWithManager /workspace/controllers/notebook_controller.go:460 main.main /workspace/main.go:70 runtime.main /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:200 2019-10-13T22:20:03.060Z ERROR setup unable to create controller {"controller": "Notebook", "error": "no matches for kind "Notebook" in version "kubeflow.org/v1beta1""} github.com/go-logr/zapr.(*zapLogger).Error /go/pkg/mod/github.com/go-logr/zapr@v0.1.0/zapr.go:128 main.main /workspace/main.go:71 runtime.main /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:200
So I used the repo workaround and got istio copied and it failed again trying to coppy "katib-db"

I'm getting no address for the ingress with the proposed solution: <denchmark-code>$ kubectl get ingress -n istio-system NAME HOSTS ADDRESS PORTS AGE istio-ingress * 80 10m </denchmark-code>
Any solutions for that?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HarryCaveMan>@HarryCaveMan</denchmark-link> -- any workaround? I'm facing that issue as well. tried manually removing katib-related resources, but no luck yet.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zmdelima>@zmdelima</denchmark-link> Thanks for the tip but I still get the same error when running ...

Sorry guys, I am kinda overwhelmed with other stuff recently and I will either
give workaround on 0.6.2 give 0.7 setups. Fix this issue with community folks
by this weekend.

0.6.2 branch, for people failed to general manifest, please change manifest branch from master to this. I use my own repo here instead. aws components has been merged back to 0.6.2. You can follow original steps and no extra customization needed.
<denchmark-code> - name: manifests root: manifests-0.6-branch uri: https://github.com/jeffwan/manifests/archive/cherry-pick-aws-manifests.tar.gz </denchmark-code>
Note: please use EKS 1.13 cluster now, I notice istio 1.1.6(in v0.6.2) is not stable on EKS 1.14 and readiness keep failing for some unknown reason. Related tickets: istio/istio#16340 istio/istio#12308
I will put some time to figure it out later this week.
For user failed to create ALB, please check ALB logs, it's possible that your config is wrong. Please give more details on alb-ingress-controller logs and I can help debug.
Please check trouble shooting guide. <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/troubleshooting-aws/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/troubleshooting-aws/</denchmark-link>
I am working on 0.7. Doc will be released this week. I will resolve all knowns issues in 0.7 release.
Updates: All 0.7 changes have been merged. It's working fine now. Please have a try. 0.6.2 have been unblocked as well. I will close this issue and feel free to reopen if you still have problems.
/close

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
/close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4642>#4642</denchmark-link>
Hi , what would be the solution for the above error.
